Uses of Class
com.codename1.io.ConnectionRequest

Packages that use ConnectionRequest
com.codename1.ads The Ads API allows developers to add Ads to their apps 
com.codename1.components Generic elaborate components that make use of both UI elements and storage. 
com.codename1.impl The implementation package should not be used by developers, it is an internal implementation detail which will break compatibility between major Codename One releases. 
com.codename1.io Codename One IO is intended as a componentized solution for IO operations that allows us to centralize IO logic while maintaining a more portable approach for threads. 
com.codename1.io.services Default WebService implementations 
com.codename1.ui.html This package is deprecated and used only for legacy support, use the WebBrowser component from the components package. 
 

Uses of ConnectionRequest in com.codename1.ads
 

Subclasses of ConnectionRequest in com.codename1.ads
 class AdsService
          This is an abstract Ads Service.
 class InnerActive
          This is an Ad service implementation by InnerActive see: http://console.inner-active.com/iamp/publisher/register?ref_id=affiliate_CodenameOne

Methods in com.codename1.components with parameters of type ConnectionRequest

          Allows binding progress to an arbitrary slider

          Allows binding progress to an arbitrary slider
 

Constructors in com.codename1.components with parameters of type ConnectionRequest
Progress(String title, ConnectionRequest request)
          Binds the progress UI to the completion of this request
Progress(String title, ConnectionRequest request, boolean showPercentage)
          Binds the progress UI to the completion of this request
SliderBridge(ConnectionRequest source)
          Displays progress only for the source object, every other object in the queue before completion will produce an infinite progress.
SliderBridge(ConnectionRequest[] sources)
          Allows displaying progress of multiple requests being sent

Uses of ConnectionRequest in com.codename1.io
 

Subclasses of ConnectionRequest in com.codename1.io
 class MultipartRequest
          A multipart post request allows a developer to submit large binary data files to the server in a post request
 

Methods in com.codename1.io that return ConnectionRequest
 ConnectionRequest NetworkEvent.getConnectionRequest()
          Equivalent to getSource() casted to connection request
 

Methods in com.codename1.io with parameters of type ConnectionRequest
 void NetworkManager.addToQueue(ConnectionRequest request)
          Adds the given network connection to the queue of execution
 void NetworkManager.addToQueueAndWait(ConnectionRequest request)
          Identical to add to queue but waits until the request is processed in the queue, this is useful for completely synchronous operations.
 void NetworkManager.killAndWait(ConnectionRequest request)
          Kills the given request and waits until the request is killed if it is being processed by one of the threads.
 

Constructors in com.codename1.io with parameters of type ConnectionRequest
NetworkEvent(ConnectionRequest source, Exception error)
          Constructs an event for an error message
NetworkEvent(ConnectionRequest request, int progressType)
          Constructs a network status update event used to update progress indicators and application logic of the current state in the NetworkManager
NetworkEvent(ConnectionRequest request, int responseCode, String message)
          Constructs a response code even
NetworkEvent(ConnectionRequest request, Object metaData)
          Constructs a callback event from a connection request with some arbitrary associated meta data
 

Uses of ConnectionRequest in com.codename1.io.services
 

Subclasses of ConnectionRequest in com.codename1.io.services
 class CachedDataService
          Simple service that allows downloading and caching data locally.
 class ImageDownloadService
          Simplifies the process of implementing an image link for labels and lists by binding a request to a component.
 class RSSService
          Simple RSS read and parse request, to handle errors just subclass this and override parsingError.
 class TwitterRESTService
          Calls to the Twitter REST API can be performed via this class although currently support for authentication isn't implemented due to the transition to oAuth instead of basic authentication.
